title: 106_hr5469
content: The Act titled "Integrity of the United States Courts Act of 2000" allows for judicial review of binational panel decisions under the North American Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act. The "Integrity of the United States Courts Act of 2000" permits judicial review in the Court of International Trade within 30 days of a binational panel's determination under article 1904 of a decision by a US investigating authority. Allegations can be made regarding panel member misconduct, bias, procedural departures, or exceeding authority. If a party believes a binational panel seriously departed from procedure or exceeded its powers under article 1904, and this affected the panel's decision, they can appeal to the US Court of International Trade for review under the Tariff Act of 1930. The Court of International Trade reviews binational panel determinations under the Tariff Act of 1930. If any actions described in the appeal are established, the court vacates the original panel decision. If actions are established, the court vacates the original panel decision and enters judgment accordingly. Decisions of the Court of International Trade are binding on the parties. Exclusive jurisdiction resides with the United States Court of International Trade for appeals under this section. The jurisdiction exclusively resides with the United States Court of International Trade for appeals related to antidumping duty or countervailing duty determinations on goods from NAFTA countries. This section is not subject to review by an extraordinary challenge committee. SEC. 3. Jurisdiction of the Court of International Trade includes reviewing binational panel determinations. Section 516A of the Tariff Act of 1930 is amended to include a final determination of a binational panel convened under NAFTA. Section 516A of the Tariff Act of 1930 is amended to include a final determination of a binational panel convened under NAFTA, which involves various amendments to subsection (g)(3)(A) including the addition of a new clause (vii) for review requests. Article 1904 of NAFTA has requested review under section 404A of the North American Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act. The amendments made by this Act will apply to final determinations of binational panels under article 1904 of NAFTA published in the Federal Register after the enactment date of this Act.
